parameters: Can you please take your SHREDDED physiques and get them
the fuck out of my kitchen? Thank you!
Hello and welcome to \C[6]The Comfy Bear\C[0] inn!
The cost to stay here for a single night is \C[14]15\C[0]G.
I also can give you various cooking supplies- for a price.
And thats a shame,\. it looks like you don't have even \C[14]15\C[0]G
to your name...\. and here I thought I was the cheapest in the land.
I wish I could sell more than just these cooking supplies
The finest selection for the FINEST MEN üíù.
Well maybe next time, you big HUNK o' meat.
omg look @ me im in the inn and they serve beer and i've

wow omg big scary men cam n talkd to me

idk where dat is, but he said \C[6]he hated all the dumb

idk what that means but ya he sed it

leave because this is a \C[1]24 hour place\C[0]!

You wish you could chop me up ABS style?\.
Well maybe you'll find me later at \C[2]some important story event\C[0] or something.
I'm here in Raevula visiting on \C[30]royal business\C[0].\.
But everyone needs a break now and then.
We need a place to cook it up into that succulent
That means you gotta have a kitchen!\.
But surely I cannot just\..\..\.. let you use my kitchen for
free!\. Even you fine young gentlemen must understand that an
But I am not a monster!
You two big\.\. STRONG\.\.\. BUUFFFFF\| young men\..\..\..
can surely handle a little cleanup work for me?
What is this,\. some kind of action RPG or something?\.
Are you trying to give us a quest?
\..\..\.. What do you want us to go do?
Oh don't you worry a thing!\.
Here at the \C[6]The Comfy Bear\C[0],\. we take pride in
However,\. there have been an increasing number of \C[25]Bearcats\C[0]
out on \C[1]Raevula's Entrance\C[0] near our little humble town.\.
I don't suppose you two would trade \C[1]the indefinite free usage of
my kitchen\C[0] for \C[2]chopping up some bearcats\C[0] just outside
To sweeten the deal,\. I'll even throw in \C[4]a few recipes that
we use here at our little humble inn\C[0], comforting classics from the
Doesn't seem like we have a choice.
But chopping up bearcats sounds like a good plan!\.
Don't they have flanks or some shit?\.
I'm sure we could wack em and if RNGesus favors us,\. maybe
we won't mutilate the flanks and we can cook em up, too!
So which bearcats do you want us to chop up though?\.
We saw easily a dozen or more on the way from the cave
Oh don't you worry your little head!\.
If you accept this,\. there will be a convenient \C[2]group of
four bearcats\C[0] just outside the gate of this town.
Well let's get to it then!
So you'll formally accept this quest then?
No really, you must accept this quest.
No really, you must accept this quest.
Did you really think you could decline a main story quest?
I mean,\. I thought we could\..\..\..
Yeah it seems easy enough,\. and with unlimited access to
this inn's kitchen, cooking shit'll be super convenient!
I wonder what recipes she will teach us\..\..\..
Well you two BUFF and HANDSOME men better run along!
Seemingly,\. you'll need to go defeat some very specific bearcats
that reside \C[1]just outside the entrance to town\C[0] if you hope
to be able to use the kitchen to make that pudding\..\..\..
We murdered those bearcats for ya!
I didn't expect you two to come back!\.
Especially not so soon if at all!
We held up our end of the deal.
Now it is your turn to hold up your end.
I am a lady of my word!\.
You may use my kitchen as freely as you like.
The innkeeper pulls a book out from behind the counter and slides
These are a few of the more common recipes we use here at
the inn.\. I don't need the book anymore, so go ahead and
just keep the recipes for your own MUSCULAR selves!
And if you find yourself needing some utensils to cook with,\.
obviously mine are for \C[1]paying customers\C[0],\. so if you
need some, you should drop by the merchant a little bit
south of the inn in this town.
you two are TRULY RIPPED,\. so I would like to at least
get you started by giving you my old pot.

Also, inside of the \Item[101] appears to contain
So we just have to go over to the kitchen to start cooking,\.
right?\. Well lets hit that stove and see what we can craft!
It appears to be a bunch of very royal-looking documents.\.
No need to ruffle her feathers, we can throw her papers on the
ground later if the need arises.
There are several bottles of what look like cheap alcohol.\.
They also appear to be mostly empty.
It is hard to miss the savory aroma wafting off of the clearly-delicious meal.\.
Kinda like oranges, to be honest.\.
It even has the texture of eating through a fucking orange.\.
God why am I still eating this?!
Well whenever you're done eating that trash,\. we should take a
minute to check this place out.\. I get kind of a weird vibe from
these people,\. and not just because they say weird shit.
Like there is something ominous aboot.
Since this is clearly a beginner village,\. we should probably
start with that \C[12]great big blue-roofed house to the left\C[0].
Looks like a mayor's house or some shit.
Why do we care about them?
Oh,\. don't mistake this for caring.
You know I have our best interests in mind-\|
A new main story quest was added to your quest log.
My favorite MUSCULAR men have returned! üòç\.\.
It has actually been a bit,\. I was worried you had
Has it really been that long?
I think it's only been maybe an hour or two tops.\.
It hasn't even switched from day to night.
Does this world even observe "day" and "night" yet?
Anyway,\. don't think about that right now, it might hurt
So since we beat the bos-\. I mean,\.
we were trying to go visit \C[1]Erocia Kingdom\C[0].
But we got no fuckin' clue how people usually get there from
here.\. You got any ideas miss innkeeper?
It used to be that people from the kingdom would visit
all the time.\. They used to just take the \C[3]Adventurer's Road\C[0],\.
but ever since the river flooded, that path was blocked off.
Well \N[1],\. that would explain why we had to jump
off the cliff to make it here in the beginning.
How long as the river been flooded?
Oh,\. only about a week actually.\.
Now that I think about it though,\. there might be another way.
We used to have this \C[31]crazy alchemist\C[0] that would
go out on "adventures"\.- or so he called them-\. and he used
to tell the kids in the village stories about \C[3]the dangerous
cliffside paths\C[0] that would take him to the other side.
I wasn't really listening.\. It was such nonsense that I just
tuned it out.\. Plus,\. he was just skin and bones.\. Not a
single MUSCLE in sight,\. unlike you two fine young MEN. üòò
Maybe one of the kids around town might remember the
I wonder which little shit knows the answer.
